specific_learning_outcomes: mention his or her name for identification and self-awareness
recognise his or her uniqueness as a creation of God
acknowledge God as the creator
appreciate his or her uniqueness as God’s special creation
suggested_learning_experiences: say their names
state what is unique about them
recite and meditate on Psalms 139:13 about being fearfully and wonderfully made
read Genesis 1:27 about being, ‘created in the image and likeness of God’
sing a song related to their uniqueness
key_inquiry_questions: Why are you a special creation?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy: the skill of knowing self is exhibited as learners say their names for identification
values: Respect: learners portray positive regard for self and others

specific_learning_outcomes: identify good thoughts and feelings
explain the importance of being joyful
list lessons learnt from Ephesians 4:26
apply the lessons learnt to cope with emotions in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: sing a song related to good thoughts and feelings
list good thoughts such as sharing with others, helping parents, being happy, being thankful, respecting others
say why it is good to be joyful
share experiences on how they cope with emotions such as anger or sadness
use digital devices to draw and colour pictures of faces depicting various emotions
role-play forgiving others when wronged
read Ephesians 4:26 and write down lessons learnt
write Philippians 4:4 on flash cards and recite it
sing songs related to rejoicing in the Lord always (Philippians 4:4)
key_inquiry_questions: How do you control your thoughts and feelings?
How do you cope with anger or sadness?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: the skill of sharing experiences is nurtured as learners tell each other how they cope with emotions such as anger or sadness
values: Love: is nurtured as learners role-play forgiving others when wronged

specific_learning_outcomes: list choices they make in day-to-day life
discuss results of choices they make in daily life
make right choices guided by the word of God
portray responsibility by making right choices
suggested_learning_experiences: in pairs, list choices they make in day-to-day life
list results of choices that they make
sing a song about good choices
Role-play ‘making right choices that are acceptable to God.’
key_inquiry_questions: What are the effects of the choices you make?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy
Learning to learn
values: Respect
Love

specific_learning_outcomes: name family members in the nuclear and extended family
draw a family tree to understand relationships within the family
explain why it is important to honour parents
respect family members for harmonious co-existence
suggested_learning_experiences: sing a song related to family relationships
name family members in the nuclear family
name family members in the extended family (cousins, aunts, uncles, grandparents)
draw a family tree and write names of family members on it
list ways of respecting family members
type a poem using a digital device about respect for family members
watch a video clip of family members eating or praying together
recite Ephesians 6:1-3 on respecting parents
key_inquiry_questions: Why is it important to know members of your family?
core_competencies: Collaboration
Digital literacy
values: Unity

specific_learning_outcomes: take care when alone with people of the opposite sex
mention ways of protecting oneself from sexual abuse
identify whom to report to if touched inappropriately or sexually abused
appreciate the body as a temple of the Holy Spirit and live a holy life
suggested_learning_experiences: sing a song related to respecting their bodies as the temple of the Holy Spirit
in turns, read 2 Samuel 13:4-14
say whom to report to if they are touched inappropriately or sexually abused
in groups, tell how they should protect themselves from sexual abuse
role-play ways of protecting themselves from sexual abuse
write 1 Corinthians 6:19 on flash cards and meditate on it
watch a video clip of children being tempted with gifts, but they say NO! to the strangers
key_inquiry_questions: Why are healthy family relationships important?
core_competencies: Collaboration: the skill of team work is portrayed as learners carry out activities in groups
Digital literacy: the skill of digital citizenship is enhanced as learners act safely and responsibly while watching video clips
values: Unity: learners collaborate with each other as they read the Bible in turns

specific_learning_outcomes: read scriptures on the attributes of God
list three attributes of God and revere Him
recognise God as a loving Father who knows them by their names
suggested_learning_experiences: in groups, picture-read 1 John 4:7-8, Genesis 1:1-25 and 1Samuel 2:2 in turns
sort and match letters on attributes of God (Sole Creator, Loving Father, Holy Father)
join words about the attributes of God from a puzzle (sole creator, loving, holy)
compose a poem on, ‘God our loving Father,’
sing a song about the love of God
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you know the attributes of God?
core_competencies: Collaboration: the skill of teamwork is portrayed as they sort and match letters
Creativity and Imagination: the skill of exploration is exhibited as learners compose a poem on, ‘God our loving Father.’
values: Unity is nurtured as they work in groups and sing a song about the love of God

specific_learning_outcomes: handle the Holy Bible with respect as the inspired word of God
identify the books in the Old and New Testament
role play naming some books in the Bible
recite Isaiah 49:16 and desire to read the Holy Bible always
suggested_learning_experiences: sing a song related to respecting the Holy Bible
role-play ways of handling the Holy Bible with respect
in pairs, observe and read charts containing books in the Old and New Testament
play games on naming some books in the Old and the New Testament
recite and meditate on Isaiah 49:16
sing a song about the books in the Holy Bible
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you respect the Holy Bible?
Why is it important to know the books in the Holy Bible?
core_competencies: Collaboration: the skill of teamwork is enhanced as learners contribute to group discussions and take up different roles while singing and role playing
Creativity and imagination: the skill of originality is developed as learners come up with new ideas while playing games on naming some books in the Old and the New Testament
values: Responsibility: is enhanced as they learn how to care for the Holy Bible

substrands.substrand_name: Bible Stories: Zacchaeus the Tax Collector
specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of Zacchaeus
recount how Zacchaeus changed his behaviour positively
demonstrate integrity when using money
discuss why it is important to repent sins in order to be like Christ
suggested_learning_experiences: read Luke19:2-10 in turns
draw and colour Zacchaeus on a tree and share the drawings with peers
retell the story of Zacchaeus
tell a friend how to turn away from bad behaviour//sin
state three lessons learnt from the story of Zacchaeus
list ways of using money wisely
sing a song related to Jesus Christ as the saviour
key_inquiry_questions: How did Zacchaeus’ encounter with Jesus Christ change his behaviour?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy: the skill of expressing their emotions is exhibited as learners tell their friends how to turn away from bad behaviour/sin
values: Patriotism: they learn how Zacchaeus dedicated his life to serving his government regardless of the challenges his work posed to him and his family

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of Balaam and his donkey
apply the story in their lives by obeying God’s instructions
acquire the value of love by speaking good things about others
acknowledge God’s greatness by revering Him
suggested_learning_experiences: in groups, read Numbers 22:1-6, 20- 34
in pairs, list the importance of obeying God and their seniors
role-play the story of Balaam’s Donkey
discuss why they should bless and not curse or speak ill about others according to Numbers 22:1-6, 20-34
use a digital device or a pencil to draw the scenarios in this story
sing a song related to obedience
key_inquiry_questions: Why did the donkey talk?
core_competencies: Learning to Learn: the skill of self-discipline is nurtured as learners work collaboratively in groups
Digital Literacy: the skill of digital citizenship is enhanced as learners use a digital device and draw the scenarios based on the story
values: Social Justice: learners advocate for harmonious relationships in society as they discuss why they should bless and not curse or speak ill about others

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of Samson; Judges 14: 5- 9
acknowledge God’s power in his or her life
trust in God to cope with the challenges of life
suggested_learning_experiences: in turns, read Judges 14:5-9
model or draw a lion
compose a poem on ‘Samson kills a lion’
watch a video clip about Samson
sing a song on God’s power
draw pictures of Samson killing a lion
key_inquiry_questions: How does the story of Samson portray God’s power?
core_competencies: Imagination and Creativity: the skill of originality is nurtured as learners model a lion and compose a poem
Communication: the skill of speaking clearly and effectively is exhibited as they read in turns
values: Respect: learners take turns to read the Bible and listen to each other’s ideas

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of Joseph interpreting a dream
apply lessons learnt by depending on God’s wisdom
recognise that, ‘the fear of God is the beginning of wisdom.’
suggested_learning_experiences: read Genesis 41:14-24, 28-30 in turns
share dreams they have dreamt about and try to interpret them
dramatise Joseph interpreting the dream
draw a picture of Joseph before Pharaoh and colour it
mention three lessons learnt from the story
sing a song related to this story
recite Proverbs 1:7
key_inquiry_questions: How was Joseph able to interpret dreams?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: the skill of sharing experiences is nurtured as learners share dreams they have dreamt about
values: Love: is inculcated as they learn how Joseph loved God and his adopted country Egypt by ensuring they had food security

specific_learning_outcomes: recount the call of Abraham
obey God’s instructions in his or her day-to-day life
mention his or her name for self-identity
discuss Abram’s change of name to Abraham
appreciate God’s blessings in his or her life
suggested_learning_experiences: sing the song about Abraham the father of faith
read Genesis 12:1-5 and retell the call of Abraham
role-play the call of Abraham
tell what they like about their names
read Genesis 17:1-5 on the change of Abraham’s name
recite Genesis 12:3 and appreciate God’s blessings in their lives
key_inquiry_questions: Why was the name Abram changed?
How did Abraham show obedience to God?
core_competencies: Collaboration: the skill of teamwork is nurtured as learners role-play the call of Abraham
Communication: the skill of speaking clearly and effectively is enhanced as they retell the call of Abraham
values: Respect: learners listen to and appreciate diverse opinions from peers

specific_learning_outcomes: narrate the annunciation of the Birth of Jesus Christ
acknowledge the uniqueness of the birth of Jesus Christ
recite Luke 1:37 and trust in God’s power
emulate Mary the mother of Jesus and lead a holy life
suggested_learning_experiences: in turns, read Luke 1:26-37
role-play the annunciation of the birth of Jesus Christ
watch a video clip on the annunciation of the birth of Jesus Christ
in groups, sing a song about the annunciation of the birth of Jesus Christ
say why sexual purity is important
recite and meditate on Luke 1:37
key_inquiry_questions: Why is the birth of Jesus Christ unique?
core_competencies: Digital Literacy: the skill of connecting using technology is portrayed as learners watch a video clip on the birth of John the Baptist
Imagination and Creativity: the skill of coming up with new ideas is exhibited as learners role-play the annunciation of the birth of Jesus Christ
values: Unity: learners work in pairs and groups to perform different tasks

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the Birth of John the Baptist
discuss how John the Baptist prepared the way for the Messiah
appreciate the need to live a righteous life by turning away from sins
suggested_learning_experiences: in pairs, read Luke 1:5-13, 57
role-play the angel’s appearance to Zechariah in the temple
watch a video clip on the birth of John the Baptist
read Luke 1:76-79 and tell how John the Baptist prepared the way for the Messiah
sing a song about John the Baptist
key_inquiry_questions: How is John the Baptist a precursor of Jesus Christ?
core_competencies: Digital Literacy
Imagination and Creativity
values: Unity

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the healing of blind Bartimaeus
recognise the healing power of Jesus Christ in their lives
appreciate Jesus’ power over sickness and disease
suggested_learning_experiences: sing a song about the healing power of God
read Mark 10:46-52 and retell the healing of blind Bartimaeus
role-play the healing of blind Bartimaeus
record the role play using a digital device
share an incident when they prayed to God for healing
key_inquiry_questions: How did Bartimaeus show faith in Jesus Christ?
core_competencies: Learning to Learn: the skill of sharing experiences is enhanced as learners share an incident when they prayed to God for healing
Communication: the skill of speaking clearly and effectively is portrayed as learners retell the healing of blind Bartimaeus
values: Responsibility: learners engage in assigned roles and duties as they role-play the healing of blind Bartimaeus

specific_learning_outcomes: narrate the story of the 10 lepers
outline ways of showing gratitude to God in day-to-day life
express gratitude to those who are kind tp them
appreciate the miracle by having faith in God
suggested_learning_experiences: in turns, read Luke 17:11-19
role-play the healing of the ten lepers
draw the ten lepers using a digital device or a pencil
tell how the 10 lepers showed faith in God
mention how they exercise faith in God
share instances when they prayed to God for healing
in groups, list ways they express gratitude to God
write a ‘Thank you note’ to God for the gift of life
list ways they express gratitude to others
sing a song related to showing gratitude to God
key_inquiry_questions: How did the 10 lepers portray gratitude?
core_competencies: Imagination and creativity: the skill of coming up with new ideas is portrayed as learners draw the 10 lepers using a digital device or pencil
Digital Literacy: the skill of connecting using technology is portrayed as learners use a digital device to draw the 10 lepers
values: Love: is nurtured as learners write a ‘Thank you note’ to God for the gift of life

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of raising the widow’s son
recognise God’s power over life and death
apply lessons learnt by showing compassion to others
pray to God when faced with challenges
suggested_learning_experiences: read Luke 7:11-16 and retell the story
list challenges they face in their lives and how they involve God
tell how they show kindness to others
say how Jesus showed compassion to the widow
watch a video clip on raising the widow’s son
write John 11:25 on flash cards and recite it
sing a song about God’s power over life and death
key_inquiry_questions: What do you learn from the miracle of raising the widow’s son?
core_competencies: Digital literacy: the skill of connecting parts of a digital device is exhibited as learners watch a video clip on raising the widow’s son
Self-efficacy: the skill of expressing their needs clearly for help is portrayed as they list challenges they face in their lives and how they depend on God to get solutions
values: Love: is nurtured as learners say how Jesus showed compassion to the widow

specific_learning_outcomes: outline the importance of forgiving others
resist vengeance as outlined in Mathew 5:39
appreciate forgiveness by not repaying evil for evil
suggested_learning_experiences: read Matthew 5:39 and say why it is important to forgive others
role-play acts of forgiveness
say why they should not revenge when wronged
sing a song about loving others
write Mathew 5:39, display it in class and recite it
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you not pay evil for evil?
core_competencies: Citizenship
Communication
values: Love
Peace
Patriotism

specific_learning_outcomes: state the importance of helping the needy
demonstrate kindness by sharing with those in need
recite Mathew 5:42 and help those in need promptly
suggested_learning_experiences: read Matthew 5:42 and tell what they have learnt
mention instances they helped someone at school, home or in church e.g. they gave a pencil, rubber or shared lunch with another pupil
role-play sharing items with those who do not have
write Matthew 5:42 on flash cards and recite it
key_inquiry_questions: How do you help those in need?
core_competencies: Citizenship: the skill of developing and showing compassion and empathy is portrayed as learners mention instances they helped someone at school, home or in church
Communication: the skill of writing clearly and correctly is exhibited as learners write Matthew 5:42 on flash cards and recite it
values: Love: is portrayed as learners sing a song about loving others
Peace: is nurtured as learners say why they should not revenge when wronged
Patriotism: is portrayed as learners demonstrate kindness by sharing with those in need

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the parable of the lost coin
list lessons learnt from the parable of the lost coin
recognise God’s love for the sinner and the need to live a righteous life
appreciate God’s love and lead upright lives
suggested_learning_experiences: read Luke 15:8-10 and retell the parable of the lost coin
role-play the parable of the lost coin
share lessons learnt from the parable of the lost coin with a friend
say how God loves them and how to lead a righteous life
tell why it is important to live a holy life as a Christian
sing a song about God’s willingness to save the lost
key_inquiry_questions: How does God show love for the sinner?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: the skill of sharing what they have learnt is exhibited as they share lessons learnt from the parable of the lost coin
Imagination and creativity: the skill of coming up with new ideas is exhibited as learners role-play the parable of the lost coin
values: Love: is nurtured as learners say how God loves them and how to lead a righteous life

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the parable of the mustard seed as guided by the Bible text
describe how the kingdom of God grows from a small beginning
explain how they contribute to the growth of the kingdom of God
appreciate the growth of God’s kingdom by evangelising to others
suggested_learning_experiences: read Luke 13:18-19 and narrate the parable
in groups, collect small seeds from the school compound
plant the seeds, water them and observe as the seeds sprout and grow to a big tree
draw a big tree with birds resting on its branches and compare it to the growth of God’s kingdom
Role-play the activities they do in Church
watch a video clip on a mustard seed
say how they respond to salvation
sing a song about the kingdom of God
key_inquiry_questions: How does the parable of the mustard seed relate to the kingdom of God?
core_competencies: Creativity and Imagination: the skill of communicating new ideas is enhanced as learners draw a big tree and compare it to the growth of God’s kingdom
Digital Literacy: the skill of digital citizenship is portrayed as learners watch a video clip on a mustard seed
values: Unity: is enhanced as learners work in groups to collect small seeds from the school compound
Responsibility: is enhanced as learners plant the seeds, water them and observe as the seeds sprout and grow to a big tree

specific_learning_outcomes: retell the story of Nicodemus’ encounter with Jesus Christ
acknowledge that repentance of sins draws us close to Christ
discuss the importance of baptism to Christians today
recite John 3:16 and believe in Jesus Christ to inherit eternal life
suggested_learning_experiences: read John 3:1-5 and say how they respond to Christ’s saving grace
role-play the story of Nicodemus’ encounter with Jesus Christ
discuss how repentance of sins can draw them to Christ
watch a video on Nicodemus’ conversion
say why baptism is important to Christians today
sing a song on Nicodemus’ conversion
tell how they respond to John 3:16
key_inquiry_questions: How did Nicodemus’ encounter with Jesus Christ change his life?
core_competencies: Communication: speaking skills are portrayed as learners read the Bible and tell how they respond to Christ’s saving grace
Learning to learn: the skill of working collaboratively is enhanced as learners discuss how repentance of sins can draw them to Christ
values: Respect: learners display humility as they role-play the story of Nicodemus

specific_learning_outcomes: emulate Joseph by resisting sexual temptations as young people
exercise assertiveness in the face of temptations/tempting situations
identify people he/she can trust for own safety
recite Psalm 125:1 and trust in God always
suggested_learning_experiences: in turns, read Genesis 39:7-12 and retell the story of Joseph and Potiphar’s wife
list lessons learnt from the story of Joseph and Potiphar’s wife
list people they can trust at home, school and in the community
brainstorm on how to escape/avoid temptations/tempting situations
in pairs, roleplay saying No! to sexual temptations
in groups, discuss whom to report to when in danger
write a poem on, ‘People I trust’
role-play saying, ‘No’ to strangers to avoid child abuse or kidnap
list the importance of trusting God
sing a song about trusting God
key_inquiry_questions: Whom do you trust at home and school?
Why should you avoid talking to strangers?
Why should you put your trust in God?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy: the skill of expressing their needs clearly for help is portrayed as learners list people they can trust at home, school and the community
Creativity and Imagination: the skill of coming up with unique and new ideas is exhibited as learners role-play saying, No! to strangers to avoid child abuse or kidnap
values: Responsibility: learners observe safety precautions as they say No! to strangers

specific_learning_outcomes: state the importance of telling the truth
resist lying as cited in Proverbs 12:19
desire to always speak the truth according to Ephesians 4:25
suggested_learning_experiences: read Ephesians 4:25
say why they should always tell the truth
in pairs, say when they did not tell the truth and how to overcome lies
write a poem on the importance of always telling the truth
write Proverbs 12:19 on flash cards and recite it
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you always tell the truth?
core_competencies: Imagination and Creativity: the skill of coming up with new ideas and originality is enhanced as they write a poem on the importance of always telling the truth
Communication and collaboration: the skill of speaking clearly and effectively is enhanced as learners, in pairs, say when they did not tell the truth and how to overcome lies
values: Integrity: learners say why they should always tell the truth

specific_learning_outcomes: read Exodus 20:12 and state the benefit of honouring parents
obey parents and teachers to promote harmonious co-existence
practise responsibility by obeying school rules
outline the results of disobedience
desire to exercise obedience in day-to-day life
suggested_learning_experiences: read Exodus 20:12 and state the benefit of honouring parents
compose a poem on the benefits of obeying parents
discuss the importance of obeying teachers
say why they should obey school rules
in groups, list the results of disobedience
sing a song on the benefits of obedience
key_inquiry_questions: Why is it important to obey?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: the skill of carrying out activities with peers is portrayed as learners list the results of disobedience
Creativity and Imagination: the skill of coming up with new ideas is nurtured as learners compose a poem on the benefits of obeying parents and teachers
values: Responsibility: learners obey parents and teachers

specific_learning_outcomes: recognise that God loves children; Matthew 19:13-15
demonstrate love by showing kindness to others
appreciate God’s love by obeying His teachings
suggested_learning_experiences: in groups, retell Jesus Christ’s love for children
role-play Jesus blessing Children (Mathew 19:13-15)
draw Jesus praying for children
watch a video clip on Jesus Christ blessing children
show love to others as taught by Jesus Christ
key_inquiry_questions: How did Jesus Christ show love to children?
How do you show Godly love to others as a Christian?
core_competencies: Imagination and Creativity: the skill of coming up with unique and new ideas is exhibited as learners draw Jesus praying for children
Digital Literacy: the skill of digital citizenship is portrayed as learners watch a video clip on Jesus Christ blessing children
values: Love: learners show love to others as taught by Jesus Christ

specific_learning_outcomes: identify personal items and how they care for them
identify school properties and how they care for them
acquire responsibility by taking care of personal and school properties
suggested_learning_experiences: display personal items e.g. pullover, pen, pencils, eraser, exercise books, text books
in pairs, list the use of each item
say why they should take good care of their personal and school items
compose a poem on taking care of personal and school properties
key_inquiry_questions: How do you take care of personal and school items?
core_competencies: Communication: the skill of communication and self-expression is exhibited as learners compose a poem
values: Responsibility: learners care for personal and school items

specific_learning_outcomes: describe ways of glorifying God with their bodies
acquire the value of holiness by keeping away from situations that lead to sin
recite 1Corinthians 6:19 on the body as the temple of the Holy Spirit
desire to lead holy lives free from sin
suggested_learning_experiences: in pairs, read 1 Corinthians 6:19-20 and mention the lessons learnt
in pairs, list sins that do not please God
in groups, discuss how to avoid situations that lead to sin
sing a song on holiness
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you lead holy lives as young people?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy: the skill of knowing self is portrayed as learners discuss how to avoid situations that lead to sin
values: Respect: learners practise humility and take turns to read the Bible and perform assigned tasks

specific_learning_outcomes: outline lessons learnt from Matthew 21:12-14
participate in church activities to grow spiritually
appreciate the church as a house of worship
suggested_learning_experiences: read Matthew 21:12-13 and list lessons learnt from the Bible text
read 1Corithinians 14:26 and list activities mentioned in the Bible text
in groups, list the activities they do in church
in pairs, list ways of respecting the church as a house of God
write a poem about respecting the church
sing a song related to serving God
key_inquiry_questions: Why is the church a holy place?
core_competencies: Collaboration: the skill of teamwork is portrayed as learners mention ways they serve God in church
values: Responsibility is exhibited as learners list activities they do in church

specific_learning_outcomes: name the disciples of Jesus Christ
describe how the early church was started
desire to turn away from sins according to Acts 2:38
suggested_learning_experiences: read Matthew 10:1-4 and list the disciples of Jesus Christ
sort the names of the 12 disciples using flash cards
search for the names of the disciples in a word puzzle
watch a video clip on the twelve disciples
read Acts 2:38-41 on how the early church was started
Role-play how the early church was started
repent their sins as guided in Acts 2:38
key_inquiry_questions: How was the early church started?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: the skill of developing relationships is nurtured as learners carry out activities together such as sorting, searching and role playing
values: Responsibility: they learn how to take up assigned roles, by following the example of the disciples of Jesus Christ

specific_learning_outcomes: name the city where believers were first called Christians
retell how Stephen was stoned for standing firm in his faith
list three lessons learnt from the stoning of Stephen
explain why they should not join ungodly groups
utilise the virtue of assertiveness and stand firm in faith
suggested_learning_experiences: sing a song related to standing firm in the Christian faith
read Acts 11: 26 and say where believers were first called Christians
identify Antioch, from a Bible map

brainstorm on lessons learnt from the story of Stephen
explain why they should not join ungodly groups; radicalised groups, groups that do not recognise Jesus Christ
list ways they can stand firm in their Christian faith
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you stand firm in your Christian faith?
Why should you not join ungodly groups?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: the skill of engaging in self-driven tasks is portrayed as learners identify Antioch from the map

specific_learning_outcomes: recite the Lord’s prayer
pray for parents, guardians and friends
say a prayer to God every day to grow spiritually
suggested_learning_experiences: sing a song related to the Lord’s Prayer
read Matthew 6:9-13
discuss why it is important to pray every day
pray for their parents/guardians, friends and relatives
recite the Lord’s prayer daily
list the number of times they pray and share with classmates
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you pray always as a Christian?
core_competencies: Collaboration: learners develop the skill of teamwork as they discuss, sing and recite the Lord’s Prayer
values: Unity is enhanced as learners pray for their parents/guardians, friends and relatives

specific_learning_outcomes: list the fruit of the Holy Spirit; Galatians 5:22-23
describe how they apply the fruit of the Holy Spirit in their lives
desire to be led by the Holy Spirit in their daily activities
suggested_learning_experiences: in pairs, read Galatians 5:22-23
list the fruit of the Holy Spirit
write the fruit of the Holy Spirit on flash cards and display it in class
in groups, list good things they should do to others as Christians
discuss how they apply the fruit of the Holy Spirit in their daily lives
compose and sing a song on the fruit of the Holy Spirit
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you have the fruit of the Holy Spirit?
core_competencies: Creativity and imagination: the skill of originality is nurtured as learners compose a song on the fruit of the Holy Spirit
values: Peace is exhibited as learners practise the fruit of the Holy Spirit such as peace and live peacefully with others

specific_learning_outcomes: practice self-control as guided in Galatians 5:23- 25
make right decisions that are guided by the Holy Spirit
demonstrate self-control by avoiding behaviour that defiles the body
live Godly lives guided by the Holy Spirit

core_competencies: Learning to learn: the skill of working collaboratively is portrayed as learners list choices they make in their day-to-day lives
Imagination and creativity: the skill of originality is exhibited as learners role-play ‘making decisions that portray self-control’
values: Responsibility is inculcated as learners list and avoid things that can defile their bodies
Integrity: learners exhibit self-discipline by not engaging in acts that can defile them e.g. watching ungodly movies

specific_learning_outcomes: list digital devices used at home and school
discuss appropriate ways of using social media
apply the value of integrity when using social media
desire to do the right thing always even when no one is watching
suggested_learning_experiences: in groups, list some digital devices that they know or use
in pairs, discuss appropriate use of social media
say why they should not chat with strangers online
use a digital device to listen to a gospel song or watch a video clip based on the Bible
key_inquiry_questions: Why should you use social media appropriately?
core_competencies: Communication: listening skills are enhanced as learners use social media devices to listen to a gospel song or watch a video clip based on the Bible
values: Responsibility: learners use social media responsibly
Integrity: learners use social media appropriately even when no one is watching them
